name: glaringly
content:
glaringly adverb
(OBVIOUS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of something bad) in a way that is very obvious: glaringly obvious Voters want solutions to economic and social ills that are glaringly apparent on their streets.
More examplesFewer examples Carolyn was made glaringly aware of her own ignorance.This remains a glaringly unresolved issue in the country today.The projects are a response to a problem that is glaringly evident.

glaringly adverb
(SHINING)
in a way that shines too brightly: The opening scene is in a glaringly bright hospital ward. They reached a small town of glaringly white buildings.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was glaringly bright in the hall after the winter darkness.The young woman sat with her coffee in the glaringly lit cafe.The restaurant was so glaringly white that it didn't seem right to enter without a bath, shave and haircut.
